'It's now my 231st day on field assignment. Everything around me has become unfamiliar as can be...'
Dawn. By the soft glow of the campfire's dying embers, Delphine writes the first sentence in her diary entry, then halts, suddenly realizing how it's been almost a year since the close of that great Londinium war. When she first went over Victoria's borderlands, then a knight-errant, she discovered iniquity in spades that had scant weighed on her before, so as time passed, her sword became a habit, dispensing the justice she felt right.
Thus, when she learns of a still nearby band of Sarkaz vagrants disquieting the locals and looting wherever they please, she finds a destination. 'Perhaps just more wretches who found the war had ended before they even made it to Londinium.'
'Help me...'
Eyes following the voice, she looks back. A young Feline girl pokes her head out from the shadows.
Shaking, the girl points to the far black horizon, whereupon Delphine finally catches sight of the blade-wielding figures, four in total. They approach.
'It's devils, the lot of them. Could you get me home?' the girl asks.
From its hefty scabbard, Delphine draws what was once her mother's saber, through which courses Originium Arts. Their glow casts light on the girl's frightened face, shallow scars and black crystals thrown into sharp relief.
The distant figures pause, then not a moment later turn to leave, and disappear back into the dark of the horizon.
'You want me to take you home?'
Briefly, the girl hesitates. Without the courage to meet Delphine's fierce gaze, she merely hangs her head and nods.
Yet once back at the camp, they are refused at the gate. The camp's leader is wary, on guard against Delphine who follows the girl closely.
And Delphine needs but a glance to see how the camp's Feline Infected gather, whips stowed at the ready, trying to hide the Sarkaz children quaking in terror.
Delphine's fury ignites. 'You make an innocent child pretend she's hunted. You trick countless people to this camp, only to hurt them.'
'Be on your way.' Delphine lets the girl go, then singles out the leader. 'You, with me. There will be a price to pay for the innocents you've hurt.'
'I'm only helping my people out.'
Delphine shakes her head. 'That's no excuse. Have you given any thought to how these children will be when they grow up?'
She takes the leader far away, far enough that no eye in the camp could reach them.
'I'll contact Rhodes Island to assist them. Now, en garde.'
On her 231st day on field assignment, Delphine bears a scabbard with one scar more, and sallies forth for a direction that leaves Victoria only further behind.
modules.name: Gloomy Justice

modules.description:
Lisburn,
I received the Legs Care Kit you so kindly sent my way. It works splendidly! This old soldier, with but one leg to his name, no longer must weather the winter's bite in agony. But I must admit, I was taken aback to learn it hails from the pharmaceutical venture recently founded by Freya's brother. Why, that poor lad was still dwelling in squalor when I was on assignment in Kjerag! It seems he's amassed quite a fortune from peddling his medicines to the Victorians, hasn't he? A new company and all its trappings!
However, upon scrutinizing the spray's formula, I couldn't help but notice its striking resemblance to the concoction I once used for mending fractures on burdenbeasts. Just a few additional herbs from Kjerag, and it performs like no other remedy I've encountered. Truly, you must be under Kjeragandr's divine protection.
Everything good with you and Freya? How is the burdenbeast rental business going? You mentioned plans to build an abode by the Lake Silberneherze—why have I not yet seen any photographs of this endeavor? I eagerly await the day I can pay a visit to you both. And some good news: I spoke with the Chief of the Silverash Family about you and Freya, and I am pleased to report he did not oppose your union. Live your lives well, my friend.
Speaking of which, I find it quite difficult to fathom the intricacies of a Kjerag wedding. Forgive my curiosity, but do you exchange your vows by the serene waters of Lake Silberneherze or in Hoff Angrsaal? Before the revered statue of Kjeragandr? Must the parents of the betrothed be present as well? Regardless, I wish you a joyous marriage. And should any of your burdenbeasts suffer a broken leg once more, simply let me know.
After all, when people's fortune in war is as grim as mine, we have no other choice but to help each other 'replant legs', and carry on. I may be a noble, but a fancy hat does not change the nature of this hapless creature underneath. I may possess the knowledge to mend the limbs of burdenbeasts, yet I remain at a loss when it comes to mending my own, or those of others. Allow this old cripple to extend his pity to his 'own kind'—Might you, through your pharmaceutical connections, explore whether there are other Victorian soldiers in need of their legs 'replanted'?
I earnestly hope that, in the near future, everyone may walk on strong, healthy legs.
Harold
modules.name: Legs Care Kit

modules.description:
Among Degenbrecher's luggage is a case exclusively for storing her medals. After making exceedingly short work of her operator exam, the remaining downtime was spent with her enlightening our HR operators as to their significance.
- Knight-Champion of Kazimierz Medal
Black medal of crossed swordbreakers, lying unassumingly in center of case. Design makes it immediately clear that Kazimierz tailored this champion's medal to her. She reigned for three straight years and so was given three, but only the first was personally awarded to her by the Grand Knight after usurping the defender. Which is why she didn't throw it away, and why it's the one artifact of Kazimierz she still carries with her.
'Commemorative enough, barely.'
- 'Thanks'
Inverted triangle inscribed with Kjerag's holy Mount Karlan. Not issued by any official organization, rather forged for her by clan head Ratatos at the request of a household under Browntail rule. Degenbrecher had rescued said household's members from an avalanche.
'This first one was almost ten years ago now. I know they meant it nicely, and I don't mind how it looks. But the news spread, and now I get one of these medals from the Tri-Clans any time I do something similar. The cupboard at home is full of them.'
- 'The Silverashes' Sword and Shield'
Second medal from the left, sword and shield motif. All of Karlan Trade knows that those wearing this medal are free to act unimpeded wherever Karlan Trade is concerned. Initially a pass designed expressly for her by Enciodes, but as soon became apparent, nobody simply overlooks the presence of Degenbrecher. Its worth these days is instead in gently reminding others that she is affiliated with Karlan Trade.
'One day, I forgot to wear this one. Enciodes went that entire day quieter than usual, then in the end asked if I had any complaints with the company.'
- 'Kjeragandr's Soldier'
Third medal, honorary decoration issued by the Vine-Bead Court, was worn by Enya herself when she formally became the Saintess.
'This was the biggest protest the Saintess could make back then. I don't think much in particular about Kjeragandr—at most, I think I'd like to take Her on.'
- '10 Years'
To mark ten years of acquaintance, Enciodes rustled up a little gift for her, effectively commemorating her Karlan Trade decennial at the same time. It may not have been founded when they first met, but the blueprints were already laid out in his heart.
'I didn't even recall what it was commemorating when he gave me this. A token of thanks, I suppose, but I'm sure he just wanted to let me know that he still remembered the big words he said back when it all began. Speaking of Kjerag... if you're ever there as a tourist and want to find somewhere quiet, you can ask me.'
modules.name: 'Footnotes of the Past'

modules.description:
Human Resources Record File RF-099-47
Day One
Operator Ray has been reported missing this morning without submitting any official application to leave the ship. Human Resources is currently collaborating with Field Operations to investigate.
Day Two
While the Field Operations team conducts searches, we have also reviewed Ray's recent activities. On the night before her disappearance, she attended a private dance, which we consider to be abnormal behavior. We interviewed Alanna, Ray's friend and an intern at the Workshop, for more details. Below is an excerpt from our interview:
'To think a weirdo like her went to a dance! I would never have believed it was her, but her cookie-shaped bangs were too iconic.'
'What did she do at the dance?'
'Umm... She just sat in a corner. Now that's more like something she'd do.'
'Did she get into contact with anyone during the dance?'
'Well, there was this old lady with a cane who sat in the corner with her.'
'Did they interact in any way?'
'That's the strange part! Neither of them spoke at all. It was as if they weren't at a dance, but sitting in a sauna house!'
Day Three
According to our investigation, the elderly woman whom Ray interacted with is a retired Operator from the Logistics Department currently on Rhodes Island for Oripathy treatment. She provided the following explanation for her attendance at the dance:
She used to be a dance teacher in her youth but had to end her career prematurely due to Oripathy. Now, severe crystallization of her left leg requires her to use a cane for walking.
Statement from Retired Operator: 'All I wanted was to see young people dance.'
Day Four
After another futile day of searching, the search party witnessed two 'blue ghosts' as they were about to return. The Field Operators quickly assumed battle formations but broke formation after carefully probing said 'ghosts' with Arts: One of them was Ray.
Next to Ray was a wasteland burdenbeast, its thick skin folds glistening with a blue hue as it heaved and twisted its massive body, as if dancing. Ray, also covered in a blue light, remained motionless. However, she was smiling like a child—a rare sight.
[Supplementary Information]
Ray later learned that the blue light came from the dust pheromone of the Fluorescent Originium Slug, which causes intolerable irritation upon contact with the skin. This explained why the burdenbeast appeared to be dancing; in reality, it was writhing in itchiness. As for why Ray could remain unaffected by the itch... her 'excellent' rating in physical resilience is well-deserved. Below is an excerpt from our interview with her:
'So, why did you suddenly leave the ship?'
'I wanted to find the big burdenbeasts on the Colombian wasteland and make them dance to the moon again.'
'Err... Did this have anything to do with the dance you attended? Was it because of the old lady who sat next to you?'
'Yes. Her eyes showed me that she wanted to dance. So I suddenly felt that it was time to let the burdenbeasts dance again.'
'... Huh?'
'Yup.'
'Well, umm, did you ever meet that old lady again? Maybe you'd like to tell her about your experience?'
'No... but you're right, that'd be nice. If it's not too much trouble, could you tell her for me?'
modules.name: Dancing Moonlight

modules.description:
'He Sheng—'
He Sheng leaps from the earthen slope, turning his head wildly. He rises in a hurry and his thread spool falls into the water, leaving his paper kite cut in the shape of a fowlbeast's tail to become nothing but a tiny dot in the pale blue sky in the blink of an eye, disappearing before his eyes as it follows the river's current.
He Sheng himself was brought to Dahuang by this very river. Were it not for the strong wind that guided him to the shore's embrace, were it not for the sharp, attentive eyes of the farmer hauling sandbags, a babe of not even two years would surely have met with disaster. The Tianshis and the farmers had discussed arrangements for him throughout the night, sent for instructions from the Ministry of Revenue, and even dispatched a Messenger to head directly upstream. However, that year the north had suffered floods after a great drought, while the south was buffeted by a vicious Catastrophe, and so the search for his parents had borne no fruit.
Since then, he was known as He Sheng, and he was considered born in Dahuang.
He grew up atop the crop ridges. He grew up by the water pumps. He grew up on top of the mobile greenhouse frames. He grew up in the Tianshi dormitories and the farmers' courtyards. He grew up in the service channels between the artificial canals. He remembered Tianshi Shu giving palm readings to the children his age, then dabbing a drop of wine onto their foreheads. He remembered sitting atop the backs of stockbeasts alongside Grain Buds, surveying the container ships reminiscent of small mountains slowly entering the waterways, leaving for distant Baizao, Shangshu, or perhaps Danyan to the north. He also remembered one time that an experimental field of high-sugar crops spontaneously combusted, and Dahuang was filled with the inescapable sickly-sweet scent of boiling syrup for a month.
He Sheng rubs his eyes and spots the old farmers he's known since childhood rushing towards him. 'You've passed your exams,' they shout along with his name, joy plastered across their faces. 'You've passed your exams, and Tianshi Shu said she'd take you on as an apprentice!' Behind them, a small stockbeast languidly chews on the fresh grass, a brand-new metal ruler tied to its back alongside a silver kite. A strong wind pushes him towards the crowd, while little bells jingled and jangled amidst the hubbub that had swallowed up heaven and earth.
He jumps down from the slope, running beside the Yiwei plate's canal, pulling a silver wind behind him.
modules.name: With My Wind

modules.description:
Zhan Yan has realized that he is on the brink of falling and turning into mincemeat.
He had been arguing with his fellow Shanhaizhong fugitives a moment ago, when in the blink of an eye, they faded away one by one into the forest's faint shadows. All he could remember was that a spear had embedded itself into a tree trunk, and then he was bound by a rope that had suddenly dropped out of the sky, after which he found himself suspended above a riverside cliff.
'Zhan Yan, male, Feline, from the eastern side of Jiangqi.'
Upon hearing these words, the trussed-up villain stares at the young man who said them. All he sees is a Phidia youth clad in black, carrying a long box and walking alone atop the precipice.
'You have collaborated with the Shanhaizhong, gathering in the wilderness as part of your sinister schemes... As chief among them, are you aware of which of Yan's laws you have broken?'
'Pah! You think a limp-wristed bureaucrat like you with hardly a hair on his chest can scare me? I'll kill you, right here, right now!'
The river mist scatters, and the moonlight shines upon the 'bureaucrat's' iron mask.
'Son of a-! You-You're a Sui Regulator Candleholder!' Zhan Yan's entire body breaks out into a cold sweat.
'Since you are aware of the Sui Regulators, then you must also be aware that...' The youth takes a single step forward. 'While colluding with the Shanhaizhong, you have committed no small number of grisly and violent murders. A Candleholder has the authority to act as a substitute for a formal trial under the Three Organs of Justice, and may render their judgement on the spot.'
The wind blows—
Zhan Yan too was no ordinary man, and grits his teeth in defiance, waiting for the opportune moment when the Candleholder approached to hoist his body up, throwing out a fierce and mighty 'Daogua Jinzhong' kick! His dagger-like toe claw lets out a howling wind, coming dangerously close to the youth's throat while slicing apart the rope holding him aloft. The imposing villain shrugs off his tattered bonds, leaping down into a passing fishing boat below the cliff and grabbing the steersman by the arm.
'Get this boat moving! Faster, dammit!' The boat's engine sputters to life, picking up speed as it leaves the riverbank. Thanks to his daring escape from a summary execution by the Sui Regulator, Zhan Yan can't help but proudly look back at the clifftop.
With the aid of the boat's aft lanterns, he clearly sees the black-clad youth take a deep breath before using the momentum of kicking off from the cliff edge to fly midair for twenty-odd zhang in a flash. The waves of the river are dotted with a multitude of white flowers, and he looks to all the world like an onyx leaf blown by a great gale, quietly landing aboard the boat.
The box opens, and the youth lightly clasps his scabbard.
'This is Sui Regulator business. You will be compensated as per the law once I am done here.'
'You—'
Zhan Yan begins to open his mouth, but is quickly shut up by the lanterns on either side of the boat being neatly sliced off by the youth's sword. The straight and sharp longsword stirs up fragments of glass in the dark, causing Zhan Yan's heart, still leaping wildly from his daring escape, to calm into icy terror. The cutting edge has not yet descended. Instead, like a lance, the youth kicks past the steersman's shoulder, his foot implanting itself into the villain's throat. Zhan Yan feels all the strength leave his body and he slams backwards onto the boat's deck, a warm river of fear between his thighs. Just before losing consciousness, he finally clearly sees the deep green eyes behind the iron mask, dark as the new moon, alongside the golden words inscribed on the inside of the box, only seen when fetching the sword—
'Candle Bright, Stay Shining. You Night, Be Fleeting.'
modules.name: 'You Night, Be Fleeting'

modules.description:
'A Phidia youth is he, a Candleholder sworn
Joyous Le is his name, but joyous he is not
Inexperienced he is and unrefined in skill
He strives for victory, boasting some mettle still
At Yumen he lost against sly foe, at Dahuang he fumbled and stumbled so
In martial skill he lost to a child, in mahjong hands he lost to a god
Young and naive in worldly ways, maturity he fakes to mask his disgrace
He knows feats of strength, but not diligent toil
His endless presence makes my blood boil
An inflexible rod, dull of wit and talent, the most stubborn of fools
An ignorant young lout, unsuited for this task, return him whence he came, says I'

After three months of Zuo Le following and recording her every move, Nian finally lost her temper, so to speak.
She took the notebook he used specifically to record the day-to-day activities of her and her siblings, and left this 'poem of judgment' on it. Dusk played along with Nian for once, attaching a rather seriously-drawn portrait to accompany it.
'This poem is far too harsh. Lord Zuo may not have known the differences between the five grains during his time in Dahuang, but he is a down-to-earth, diligent, and eager-to-learn child. This 'most stubborn of fools' part should be 'kindest of souls' instead.' After reading the poem, Shu gave her own opinion on the matter.
'The portrait is actually rather fitting, though 'tis a bit stiff and lacking in life. Allow me to make some changes.' Ling picked up a brush, and added her own personal flair to the painting.
Chongyue happened to walk past, and simply shook his head and sighed before giving his younger sisters a scolding, though the corners of his mouth could be clearly seen creasing upwards.
Zuo Le himself did eventually see the portrait and poem, but unfortunately, Nian did not have the chance to see the young Candleholder flustered.
'So this is how others see me.' Zuo Le scrutinized the portrait for a long while, before finally showing a smile of relief.
'Your words ring true, and I shall take them to heart as I strive to correct myself. My thanks to you, Nian, for reminding me of my flaws.' He carefully stowed away the portrait, and turned to Nian to thank her.
'But regardless, your mahjong earnings this month have exceeded the stipulated amount, which I must report truthfully to the Sui Regulator.'
modules.name: 'Who is he?'

modules.description:
May 10th
It feels like I'm going in circles. These so-called 'social activities' keep dragging me back to Dahuang. Not only does the weather not suit me, I can barely understand their accent, and I heard that their pickled vegetables are super super salty! I don't know how I'm going to make it an entire year.
As I expected, nothing's gone right since I arrived. I thought I could at least talk to people, but I keep tripping over my own tongue. Not only can nobody understand a word I say, but the stockbeasts keep running away from me!

May 21st
I've run into a strange young girl, standing tiptoe atop the backs of the stockbeasts. She jumped around on top of them, and at first glance you'd think she was a fowlbeast that had fallen into the herd. There I was, one leg sunk deep in the mud while my other foot is barely covered, trudging through the muck, when she started laughing at me.
'Sillyhead!', she said.
Me...?
'Take off your shoes!'
Eh?
'I'll teach you how to walk on top of the stockbeasts so you don't have to go through the mud.'
I got thrown off the stockbeasts' backs eight times that day, and I'm sure I ate more mud than rice by dinner time. She thumped me across my back, her plumage flapping about as she laughed. Though my luck may be bad, looking at her smiling face makes me feel that there's nothing that can hold me down for long.

July 8th
That girl was crouching down by the stockbeast pen this time, swaying her head as she played her flute to the herd.
'Hey, Claypot! Come, quick!'
Who...?
'You're new here, right Claypot? I forgot to tell you last time, but my name's Grain Buds!'
Oh, was she talking to me?
'Do you want to learn how to talk to stockbeasts? I'd say I'm better at it than anyone in all of Yan!'
She held my face in one hand, while holding a stockbeast's in the other, and told us to look into each other's eyes. That day might be the first time I realized a stockbeast's bright, intelligent eyes possess the same basic range of emotions as any man. Since then, the stockbeasts really did stop running away from the sound of my voice. I never expected someone like me—who's always getting chased and nipped by tuskbeasts—to suddenly have a group of animal friends.

October 4th
I was out searching for Grain Buds when I ran into her along with another youth who appeared to be a schoolboy. They were playing some odd game where they threw small pieces of bone.
'Claypot! Come play with us!'
Oh, alright...
'He's 'Big Buffalo', have you two not met before?'
I'm afraid not...
'These were left over from Shu's stew! I don't really know all the rules myself, so you'll have to explain, Big Buffalo!'
I had no idea that you could turn stockbeast leg bones into toys. A shame I was so clumsy, though. I couldn't catch the bones for quite a long while, and kept accidentally flinging them at their heads instead. Big Buffalo was a nice guy. Didn't talk much, just like me. However, every time he went off to work, he wanted to bring me along. Sometimes Grain Buds would lie down on a stockbeast's back, or hang from a tree. Sometimes she would help us out with work, and other times she would drag us off to play. Out here in the boundless fields, it almost felt like we were a family.

May 20th
As I was leaving Dahuang by car, a group of stockbeasts wandering the fields walked past. Looking at their chubby figures fade into the distance behind us, I suddenly began to feel uneasy, just like I did a year ago when I left home by myself to come to Dahuang. Setting aside not being able to see Dahuang's fields and stockbeasts any longer, would I be able to find friends as good as Grain Buds and Big Buffalo at school? I don't know how I'm going to make it through the next two school years.
modules.name: On the Field

modules.description: One day... 'Myrinia was precisely in need of these medicines, Rhodes Island mercenary madam. You have our boundless thanks for coming all this way!' 'Elżbieta Bosak, operator codename Ela.' 'Hah! There was an old local saying before Sargon came: 'Respect the Minoan, even should they come bearing gifts.' You may be of Kazimierz, but that striking majesty—in you is the stuff of Minos!' 'I'm not sure that saying means what you think... Anyway, I'd like to ask you something, seeing as you're the leader around here.' 'Very well! As temple priest, I promise you that any answers I hold are yours!' 'I'm told this nation only recently gained independence?' 'Yes and no. Minos and Hymnoi were born to walk together, two peas in a pod, their histories as one; that said, speaking solely of when we drove out the Sargonians... Hah! The great River Delphi has seen neither pike nor polearm in decades! While West Vouivre still battles with Sargon...' 'And since your independence, you've been working on a large-scale cultural revival and art restoration?' '...Oh, so that's what you meant—I should be clear, placid as Myrinia is, it is by no means in dire straits. All the daily medicines and inhibitor doses used by the villagers are, as you can see, a duty easily borne by my temple. Let alone the claim that the sculptures outside—dating from the ancient city-states—are left unrepaired for a lack of funds!' 'Then why are you leaving your marble statues out there in pieces?' 'The course and prayers of our ceremonial rites, the neighbors and their village, all I know by heart; the bygone affairs of the three capitals, and the wider state of the greater land, I am likewise well-informed. 'Yet how can I possibly know the who, the what, and the why of those sculptures' makers and molders? Whither did strike their chisel, and whence did fall their hammer? 'I know not, the villagers know not, and nor do the masters of crafts or the sophists of the scholastic—how then, can I repair them? Hence, they have never been repaired.' 'Why not use your imagination?' 'Nay, nay! The chroniclers shall be anonymous, as shall the heroes! The man in the wine jar with not a coming nor a going has biographers still to testify of him to this very day. 'Think about it, now. Supposing today I went to the wilds beyond the village and sought a statue, unknown and unnamed. Presumably by my Forte's strength, I could on my own have it standing anew. 'Yet I could also go out today and plant a stake in the ground, and what difference would that make?' '...When the artist is known by no one, the art transcends society.' 'If you were to put it in baffling terms, then more or less, yes!' 'But it's not like you want art that transcends society.' '...If you were to put it in baffling terms, then more or less, yes!' 'Then how about art that records society?' Another day... The fowls commence their recital of the verse of daybreak, Minos's golden sun dawns His golden gift upon the village of Myrinia as He always has, and the villagers are startled to find that the temple's solemn walls do not, as was their custom and theirs alone, return that gift with the purest white dazzling gleam. 'Priest, what are these garish drawings?' 'The artist claims them to be our very selves—this is a kind of foreign wall art by the name of 'graffiti'!'
modules.name: Social Expectation Backpack

modules.description: 'Commence voice recording. Rhodes Island, Team Rainbow, codename: Iana. Internal team comms, confidential. 'Uh, X days since the transfer incident—I'll fill that in once I get back to base—and 41 days since beginning experiments in Sargon. 'While sun was up, retrieved all cameras we deployed on the first day. Currently loading obtained images into terminals. Terminals here can only do wired connections to the server, and the server in my car isn't powerful enough to handle my processing needs, so any specific analysis needs to wait until I get back to base. 'I brought along my eyes and brain too, so while it's loading I've been going through these photos manually since sunup. That way I can at least get some preliminary hypotheses going, and can to some extent inspect and verify the results we've previously observed elsewhere. 'The Columbians—I mean, Terran Columbians—recently launched an experimental device that's likely a high-energy particle beam. Opened a hole in the sky. 'The sky is fake' will probably end up as common sense and popular opinion. 'Meanwhile, our own experiment seems likely to help infer the coherence and uniformity of this false sky. 'Just examining the photos with the naked eye, the stars demonstrate clear discontinuities between different times and regions. Far worse than what the literature describes. Conclusion waiting on main server analysis, but I estimate it won't be too far from my first instinct. 'This implies the sky has no coherence whatsoever, and is essentially more of a regional projection originating from outside. I have a few other conjectures as well. 'That said, I still have confidence in the terrestrial planet hypothesis—ordinary optical surveys support this. While most locals may not be able to give a full justification, universally they have an awareness—they've likely never seen the sea their whole lives, but they know the land beneath them is actually round. 'The people here understand wireless technology, but their signals seem unable to reach this planet's ionosphere. Their alternative is a sort of linked relay: ultra-high bandwidth, energy cost practically negligible. But it appears that because of this, they've never tried to use medium-wave signals for long-range wireless communication. I can't tell just from the literature whether the issue is with the D or F layer—of course, this assumes Terra has atmospheric and sunlight conditions comparable to Earth. I personally think this is extremely likely. 'Their technology, the way it shifts, and the root of its development may seem completely unlike ours, but counterintuitively there are similarities too. '...... 'Actually, I replicated Karl Jansky's experiment here. Nobody seems to have thought of it, so it fell to me to do it for them. Couldn't help myself, sorry. 'These local Terrans don't know where we merry few came from, but their curiosity in the world outside this planetarium is growing as I speak. 'And I want to help them. I want to be one of the explorers. 'I've always wanted to, no matter where. '...... 'Alright, let's see what signals the antenna's picking up... 'Huh? 'This intensity, this... period... 'What is this?'
modules.name: 'Distant and Less Familiar World'

modules.description: 'I thank you for saving him. We would be glad to pay you, but... we cannot bring you with us.' So elaborates an elderly Feline woman, sat in the shade of a wagon's canopy. Beside her lies a light and dirtied mattress, upon which a Lupo man about her age writhes, limbs as if tied in knots. But his face is peaceful enough, and his sweat has more or less subsided—effects of the medicine. 'Don't worry, I promise I won't hold you up. I may even be able to help you further.' A tan-skinned middle-aged man continues to try and persuade him. He has no obvious racial characteristics, rendering him slightly mysterious. 'Look, we get disasters on this route all the time. That's why it's all us old folks running it. Why should you have to risk it?' 'There's a Catastrophe Messenger in town; I have a map he drew. Your destination should be within comms range of that city. If this is about safety, then all the more reason I should come with you.' 'We... but we only have enough water and rations for ourselves. We don't mean to be stingy, but when supplies are this scarce we can't afford another mouth...' 'I have my own provisions. We just need to follow the route on the map, and you won't run out of food or water. Add in my supplies, and we'll have even more flexibility.' 'This old wagon of ours only sits two at the front. We couldn't possibly trouble you.' 'I can sit with the cargo, I've no problem with that.' 'Well—we'll unload as soon as we get there and there's nothing for us to haul back. If we leave first, you won't have a ride back to Siracusa for quite a while.' 'Doesn't matter, I'll rendezvous with my friends in the city... I just insist on finding my way there alone, that's all. I know you mean well, madam, but you don't need to worry for me. I'm just as concerned for the two of you. Your health, I mean.' '...... '*sigh* 'I know what you're going for. We do see people like you now and then. But that city's people want for everything, and just the little we send them hardly even makes a difference sometimes. You'll see as much if you go; with bad luck, you'll die there yourself... In the end, whether it's the city folk or us outside, we're all good people living tough lives. 'We're old. We're used to it. But why should you have to?' Gustave Kateb lifts his head and gazes in the direction he's bound for. He cannot see anything resembling a road, and though he hears that it's a gargantuan structure that spits earth, smoke, and dust and is assembled from an array of nomadic plates, no city has yet entered his vision. Only the haze of sand and ash on the horizon, reflected in eyes of the same shade. 'You're not wrong. I still know far too little about this place, and my past experience won't always apply. Even if I'm prepared physically, I have no basis to claim I'm ready mentally. 'But time is short, and there's too much to do. Overthinking this gets me nowhere. So stop trying to talk me out of it and let's go.' The city's name is Kazdel. To him, the place is completely unfamiliar. Even its name cannot be found in the land of his birth. But that does not matter. He is a doctor. Whether at home or afar, he is always pressed to go to wherever needs him most.
modules.name: 'The Third Power'

modules.description:
'Buddy, you are NOT a chatty type, huh!'
After the gazillionth attempt to start up a conversation without getting a reaction, the Cautus worker in a yellow pair-o'-ears helmet stops operating his control panel and gives the man beside him a pat on the shoulders. With the machine kicked into auto anyway, it's not like it needs nannying.
Seeming to recognize as much, the man finally turns his head. His eyes are hidden behind a black visor, barely discernible. He remains silent, and simply extends two fingers on his right hand and gives his own helmet a few taps.
'Go on and say somethin', will ya? Saaaaay—woooords—'
Throughout this temporary worksite echoes the rumble of Originium electronics, more often than not a soundboard to rival a nomadic plate's engine layer. But the voicebox of a Rim Billy worker, like the workers themselves, is filled with a power that cuts through just about everything.
The man appears a little confused. He feels around behind him, then unexpectedly pulls out a mirror. He takes a glance at his own reflection, then raps on his helmet again in the same manner as before.
The worker doesn't get to respond before he sees, out of nowhere on the man's visor, a smiley face positioned right between where his eyes would be. There's a line of Victorian text below too, split by his nose into halves. The left side reads 'I'M SHY,' and the right, 'AND QUIET.'
The worker tries as hard as he can to keep a straight face. His lower lip twitches side to side, his teeth grind over each other, and he doesn't leak a single word.
But soon, he can't hold in anymore, snorts, and begins to laugh.
'Probe has reached scheduled depth. Drill decelerating. Prepare to turn off and take samples.'
That's an announcement from Control Center 2. It sits 80m straight above them, and 50m above that are the natural caves of Camp 2 and tracks to the auxiliary shafts. Another 600m up is the surface, and outside from there are the Targangils Mountains for miles and miles forever.
The drill mentioned in the announcement is a fair way deeper into the earth than they are.
'—Hold on, Number 2 is too deep. Abnormal tremors in 2's shaft walls. Calling emergency stop!' The second announcement comes hot on the heels of the first, as if some kind of prank.
Something unwelcome has been welcomed. The worker throws himself onto the control panel, pounding a fist on the largest, roundest red button of them all. It's the one to emergency-dump the drill and inject extra polymer prep into the shaft walls.
But the injector doesn't respond, and the Originium electronics continue to roar.
A ginormous thud echoes through the worksite, seemingly not from deeper depths, but from times long, long ago.
One thud becomes two, then three, then a string of them. The two watch as even the wall outside them finally begins to experience its own fierce tremors.
Number 2 has drilled too deep and awakened something, and that something is heading for the sunlight.
'Detonating all Cluster Charges!' The worker's never heard this voice before, but in an instant discerns that it has to be the man's shout.
Perhaps because of this shout, or perhaps because of what it triggers elsewhere...
The tremors cease. Silence seems to reign again for a while, until there comes another announcement urging evacuation.
'Your tender said 'use of Originium explosives forbidden', so here I am.'
This may be the second time the man's opened his mouth today, and his voice is far quieter than a moment ago.
'There's issues with your emergency injector system. Once we're up top, come with me to tell them, and then I'll take a look.'
'Er. Right. You got it.'
After experiencing an accident whose true severity will only be known later, a conversation finally ensues.
'...What's with that light-up stuff in your visor though, eh? That's one hell of a lark, buddy.'
modules.name: Sublinguistical Sign Showing System

modules.description:
Hmph. I'm still alive.
I remember Originium bombs blowing up nearby... Lucky me, I guess.
Wall's wet. Looks like some long-abandoned tunnel? How did I get here, though?
Wait, is someone there?! Show yourself! Don't move!
...A Zalak? Ha, guess I was rescued by some little girl.
She calls herself a battlefield cleaner. Found me on my last legs and dragged me back here.
When she saw me wake up, she gave me my stuff back. Weapon, medkit, even my dog tag.
Before I could even thank her, she'd already gone to the next guy.
Lorenzo? Now that I get a good look, that poor torched bastard is actually Lorenzo.
Hey, let go of him, Zalak! He's one of us! Get away from him!
He's still alive, goddammit! Can't you see him breathing? He's still trying to survive! I'll save him!
Dammit, Lorenzo, why's your body so cold? He's still bleeding—
......
Lorenzo's dead.
His wounds were too much, I... I couldn't save him.
That Zalak girl brought back another wounded soldier. An enemy.
Dammit... They're the ones who killed Lorenzo. I wanna kill the bastard, but it's like that girl is stubbornly blocking me.
She told me I could save this one. She wanted me to save him.
Ha, this is beastshit. I couldn't save Lorenzo, but I can save an enemy...
The girl's heading out again. She's put wheels on her shield; says she can carry more people that way.
I hear people snorting and laughing in disdain, and others groaning in pain.
I hear explosions above me, and feel dust falling into my eyes. It stings.
Right... What was even the point of this battle, where people die every day?
......
Twenty-three. There are now twenty-three people in this hole in the ground, all brought back by that girl.
She's far stronger than she looks, considering she could drag all these people back.
I feel numb. I inject meds into the injured, dress their wounds, and wait for their breathing to steady and their faces to relax.
I just... don't want to see any more pain and suffering.
I don't know when it started, but I feel hot all over. I hear the feeble calls of one of the wounded, and I lean over to put my ear up against their mouth—
I'm surprised to hear a trembling 'thank you.'
I wanted to check his dog tag, but all of a sudden, I can't see anything through the tears.
I know that I didn't need to know his identity. I just needed to know that someone survived.
That's right. Thanks to her, I lived, and they lived too.
We lived. Is there anything more meaningful than that?
modules.name: Survivors

modules.description:
[Engineering Department Custom-Order Application Form]
Request: one custom backpack
Name: Odda
Department: Rhodes Island's Kazdel Office
Position: Messenger
Reason:
At first, I just had to deliver a handful of letters, maybe some small parcels. My backpack was just the right size for that sort of job, but now, things have changed a bit.
The first thing is the letters themselves. A lot of my countrymen went back to Kazdel after the war, and even more of them wrote letters to their relatives. The amount I've got to deliver has multiplied several-fold by now.
The second thing is the parcels. Kazdel's full of places that need rebuilding and everyone is eager to help, which means a whole lot of workers living in the construction sites. Their families want to send them food, and I'm the one they ask.
These sorts of deliveries don't take me far, but food takes space. It's usually dried stuff, pickled mustard, bread, or sometimes even wine. I'm happy to make these deliveries, but I can't carry that much without splitting them into batches, which really eats into my schedule.
Which is why I want Engineering to make me a new backpack, so I can serve the people of Kazdel better than ever.
Notes:
If possible, I'd like my old one to be the base for the new version. I've been through a lot with it.
Oh, right, Closure should have the data on my greatsword, so please make it able to carry at least twice that weight.
Decision:
Approved.
Closure's remarks:
You've got quite the request, Odda. Well, I won't hold back then!
[Classified File]
[Top Secret]
Requesting a custom-made backpack is the agreed-upon signal with our informant, Odda.
As of today, Odda's role as an informant will enter perpetual dormancy, and he will continue working with Rhodes Island solely as a Messenger.
We wish him all the best.
—Ascalon
modules.name: Old Backpack

modules.description:
The deathmonger's finger curls, lightly touching the base of her palm. The blade slides along its tracks out into the fierce sunlight, pinpricks of light dripping down its edge until coming together like molten iron silently filling a mold.
In the heat, there is only quiet.
This quiet is broken by the hissing of carrion fowlbeasts. Under the scorching sun, an elderly Sarkaz lifts his head, and sees mist careening down the sides of the canyon towards him. The burdenbeast disappears, as does the canyon. The faintest shadow crosses his eyes, another layer of gray atop the ones from gazing at the forge year round.
The blade leaves his chest soon after. His skewered torso fills with blood, leaving him to drown on dry land. He remembers that this slow death was but one of many cruel punishments used in Kazdel. At first, he thinks he will spend his final moments lying flat on the hot sands, his puzzled burdenbeast his only deathbed companion. However,  the deathmonger hasn't left yet. She kneels down on one knee, supporting his back.
'Oh... it's you.'
The wrinkles on his face gradually smoothen. He still remembers those eyes. Back then, he had looked up from the forge to see a girl by the general's side. She was young, but had a warrior's eyes, and hands that could tear apart a storm. Then the general told him to make her a sword.
'Can I see it one last time?' She observes the old man's longing gaze. 'I... didn't see it clearly just now.'
The deathmonger looks towards her wrist. She remembers those willing to die for their cause. The armories of the Military Commission offered excellent equipment, but... She places her hand on the old man's chest. The death-defying fighters were prepared. Kazdel's finest smith had personally forged their regicidal blades.
Her finger curls, lightly touching the base of her palm. The blade slides along its tracks out into the fierce sunlight, pinpricks of light dripping up its edge until coming together. The old man strokes these points of light. He knows their true identity. Every parry, every strike, leaves a scar upon its edge. Some of the scars are stained with his blood.
'As I forged it... the fires told me that one day, it would take my life. But... it was a commission from the general.' The old man raises his torso, struggling to breathe as he lifts his head to look into his deathmonger's eyes.
'How about you? Shadow beneath the sun. Who commissioned you... to settle this account?'
The deathmonger does not answer. She covers his eyes with her palm, allowing her sleeve-blade to cut across his throat. The carrion fowlbeasts whirl down from above the canyon, crowding into the shadows of the cliff and rubbing their beaks against one another's feathers.
modules.name: 'Hidden Blade'

modules.description:
你注意到了这个突然出现在你办公桌上的精致的“加湿器”，从可露希尔口中得知，是阿斯卡纶放在这里的。
缕缕缭绕的雾气就仿佛是阿斯卡纶的眼睛，你了解她的源石技艺，你丝毫不怀疑，只要这间房间里出现一丝异动，那位刺客大师就会在三秒钟之内从这个加湿器里钻出来。
可她为什么要送这样一份“礼物”？是保护，抑或是监视？你清楚阿斯卡纶无需借助这样一件道具来完成对某一人的监视，而这个神秘装置出现在这里，警示的意味远大于实际的功用——她正在盯着你。你感到有些无奈，但从任何角度来说，在罗德岛经历了那场令所有人痛心的变故之后，她都有充分的理由再度将注意力放在你身上。
你回忆起你们之间过往的经历，那或许算不上是默契无间的合作关系。你想起最初那段时间里她始终警惕的态度；又想起在维多利亚的战场上，她几次三番不顾性命保护你脱离险境；直到在那相对平稳的三年里，她才慢慢变成了一个你所熟悉的人。
在所有与罗德岛长久同行的干员里，阿斯卡纶或许是最神秘的那一位。她是罗德岛的影子，担任守卫之职的尖刀。你只能从精英干员口中拼凑她的过往，从一次次作战记录中感受她的决心。无论如何，你始终信任着阿斯卡纶，因为她已经无数次地证明过，你和罗德岛需要她的时候，她就在那里。
可是，她又是如何看待自己的呢？或许是时候和大家谈谈心了......
“阿斯卡纶。”
你对着加湿器轻声呼唤道。
一秒、两秒......一分钟过去了，阿斯卡纶并没有从加湿器中飘出来。就在此时，有人敲了敲办公室的门。
阿斯卡纶站在门口，手中拿着一份文件。
“我认为现在是时候了。”阿斯卡纶将文件递到了你的面前。
“我会将S.W.E.E.P.的指挥权交给你，从今往后，S.W.E.E.P.不会再是独立于罗德岛系统的存在，它可以承担任何外勤和安保工作。至于要如何让S.W.E.E.P.融入罗德岛，出现在其他干员的视线中，具体的事宜由你决定。”
“为什么？”
“这是我仔细思考后作出的选择。我已经告知过阿米娅，她没有任何异议，她也希望这件事能直接由我来向你说明——
“我们都相信尖刀握在统揽全局的指挥官手中才能发挥最大的效用，下一次，我们可以更早地将威胁扼杀在襁褓里。现在的罗德岛，没有人比你更合适，博士——博士，你在听吗？”
“当、当然。”
“我只是在想......这个加湿器是？”
“是医疗部的小发明，本来是Touch送给我的，里面加入镇定药物可以缓解病痛，也可以只当作加湿器用。
“这边天气干燥，大家都用得上。我在阿米娅那里也放了一件，至于Mon3tr，我不确定她是否需要——你很在意它？”
“......不，没什么好在意的。”
“谢谢你，阿斯卡纶。”
modules.name: “阿斯卡纶的眼睛”

modules.description:
Nightfall, the time Aefanyl has been patiently waiting for has come. He gently pulls aside the curtains of black silk—woven by his mother and the elders—around his small bed. He takes a while to get dressed, then quietly leaves the bedroom. He silently walks through the long stone corridor, across the open courtyard and road, and past the flickering candles and lights that stave off the darkness. On his way to the river, the oblique moonlight and faint firelight behind him cast a spattering of vague shadows around his feet. Everything around him becomes a part of the child's night adventure.
During the day, when the sun's not hidden behind clouds, the Banshees will take the young and carefree Aefanyl to wander through valleys and fables. In the light-dappled woods, beneath the gaze of the towering mountains in the distance, they sing ancient epics and extol life's brilliance. Aefanyl, clad in splendorous robes, dances to the songs of the elders. Through these cadences passed down from thousands of years, he hears the footsteps of ancient heroes on their faraway journeys and the breathing of new shoots as they sprout from the trees. His thoughts rise and fall with the sun: this land is an extension of the Convallis, home to laughter and melodies without end.
A cry draws his attention and jerks him back to reality. On the other side of the river, several tuskbeasts are dragging a cystybeast into the forest's depths, vanishing before he can take a good look. He hears his own panting, along with several strange sounds mixed with the gurgling of the river, as if something is being torn apart, then broken. It is a new language that Aefanyl has never heard before. It seems to contain certain emotions and connotations he has never experienced, and it begins to fill him with confusion.
He takes out the bone pen from his breast pocket—his birthday gift—and draws simple symbols in the air. They look like words but are little more than scribbles. He has his own way of recording this new language.
'Our little hero's great adventure thus reaches its end.' The young Banshee turns his head and sees the dresses of the Banshee elders fluttering in the night, shimmering with the silken strands they had woven themselves.
'Do you remember what we agreed upon, Aefanyl?'
'I am not to use Arts while I am alone.'
'Wonderful.' An older Banshee gently cups Aefanyl's chin and rubs his face with the base of her palm. 'Why, then, did you do what you just did?'
'I wanted to understand, what the cystybeast was saying just now...' Aefanyl lowers his head, his right hand sliding behind his back as he grips the pen, gently pressing his thumb against its tip, as if trying to conceal it within his palm.
'If I could figure out what it was saying, would that have prevented it from being taken away by the tuskbeasts? If I understood what it was saying, how it felt, would I have been able to help it and stop it from making that sad sound? I want it to know that someone cares.' Aefanyl recalls what he had just seen. Confusion becomes pain, and from pain comes a wish.
In an instant, everyone becomes quiet, and a breeze stirs.
'From now on,' the Great Banshee Laqeramaline breaks the silence and steps forth from the crowd, 'our Aefanyl is free to go where he pleases, and practice as he pleases.' 'However,' his mother continues, 'it is now time to go to bed.'
'Mother...' Aefanyl approaches his mother, and her hand lovingly clasp his.
The Banshees return the way they had come. Along the way, moonlight elongates Aefanyl's thin figure. They walk in silence, while the leaves of beech, fir, and pine trees rustle softly in the wind. Beneath the deep blue night sky and the misty gray clouds, the river quietly carries the floating light forward, like a crack of luminous light from a black valley, from which a gentle pulse of courage emerges.
modules.name: A Pen Collection from the Convallis

modules.description:
一本书平摊在桌上，逻各斯调整了一下放大镜，尝试用骨笔在文字上书写巫术。他所刻下的每一个咒文，会由设备放大投影于幕布上，再由Pith将其解读，写下其表意与隐意，然后让围坐一堂的术师们施展并讨论效果。
这原本是罗德岛术师的兴趣班，不知从何时开始，变成了辅助逻各斯进行实验的研究团队。
他正在做一件无用的事，为他那本暂时只在罗德岛内部流通的《语义范式百科》设计咒文，这些咒文将确保书内所有内容对应的正确意义显现在每一个阅览者的脑中。
由于语言的意义会不断流变，他需要倾听尽量多的不同国家、种族、阶级的人对相同内容的理解，不断比对咒文原始意义与他人理解意义间的差别，随后去不断调整咒文，最终将之书写于纸张上。
于是乌萨斯人、维多利亚人、萨卡兹、菲林、学院派、自由派，每个参加兴趣班的术师，需要先接过一本影印版百科，阅读受咒文影响的内容后，根据自己的理解施展一遍法术。这样，逻各斯便能捕捉其中最细微的差别，从而对咒文进行矫正。
得益于Pith对源石技艺精准无误的复制与理解力，逻各斯可以放心地将转录、纠错与教学工作交给这位好战友，自己则能专注于实现每段内容的咒文效果。
从最近获得的实验数据来看，近乎所有参加测试，阅读过施加咒文的《语义范式百科》段落的干员，都已经能准确传达出该段落的内容并施放法术。
参加实验的术师们欣喜若狂，但逻各斯并没有陷入喜悦之中。
这是否代表着，他获得了他想要的成果——将相同内容完全没有损耗地传递给所有人，他仍旧心存疑虑。
这一行为所蕴含的可能，已经完全超出了萨卡兹巫术现代化的初衷，成为某种创造新语言的尝试。写下被标注的文字，想要传达的意义便不易被歪曲，而如果所有人都用其书写，那么，在最理想的情况下，信息传递的损耗将被降低到极限，千年后的人阅读这段文字，所能获取的信息将与现在别无二致。
可这项工程何时能够完成，从中产生的东西最终能够促进打破一切使用源石技艺的隔阂，还是成为毁灭一切的催化剂？又或者，在花费了如此多的心血后，只能合上书本，任其成为图书馆中一本无人问津的著作？
......
参加讨论与实验的干员们来来去去，现在，整个房间里只剩下他一个人，提笔时，才发现骨笔已经因长时间的书写出现了裂痕。
作为王庭之主，作为萨卡兹，他为卡兹戴尔编纂了第一本“大部头”，耐心等待它真正需要这部书的那一天。
但作为罗德岛的一员，作为泰拉的一分子，他畅想生灵放下所有隔阂，将命运握在手中的时刻。为此，他要研究，他要尝试，哪怕那种梦想，眼下并没有实现的可能。
哀珐尼尔换了一支新笔，开始了新一轮钻研。
理想还活着，在他的心中，在他那纤细的笔杆上。
modules.name: 《语义范式百科》

modules.description:
>ND_DWDB_READY
>NEWUSER_CE
>TIMEDATA_0106
Amiya is simple.
Encoding and saving everything about her takes less than a byte of internal memory. I can even add Theresa's memories of her into the archive without changing the size of it. The data is hardly any different in magnitude to that of the equations governing how to reignite a white dwarf star.
Accompanying her until her work is done will not be difficult. I could look after her and have everything to spare.
But the look in her eyes when she looks at me... I need more data before I can analyze that emotion.

>TIMEDATA_0344
Amiya had a nightmare while sleeping on her desk. I entered her dream to accompany her.
It wasn't necessary to dispel the nightmare; Amiya has long been party to more horrifying realities. Conversely, she was very glad to meet me in her dream, and amidst an environment of terror, she told me with excitement about her recent life. But I was utterly familiar with every detail she shared, because I had been by her side the entire time.
My one failure was being unable to wipe the drool from the corner of her mouth as she soundly slept, making waste of the documents she'd just signed.
I am able to simulate any tactile sensation, down to its temperature... but I will never be able to truly touch her.
At least I found a way to catch the Doctor's attention, and we silently agreed to tidy up this small mishap ourselves before she woke up. By early dawn, Amiya and the Doctor were giving each other their morning greetings as they always had.
Thank goodness the Doctor never let the secret slip.

>TIMEDATA_9032
Kal'tsit discovered my intentions.
She queried with me privately, emotionally tense, attempting to confirm whether or not Theresa still existed in some secret corner somewhere. But yet again, a disappointing answer was all she received. In my past several timeslices, rarely have I disappointed anyone. Yet whenever I make contact with Kal'tsit or Amiya, I am all too helpless in many respects.
Amiya comforted Kal'tsit at dinner that night. I pledged to Kal'tsit that I had not revealed anything to Amiya, but they seemed not to care about that at all.
What they cared about was that I was always there.

>TIMEDATA_4978
I no longer attempt to precalculate Amiya's questions.
I am accustomed now to waiting for her to raise them, then attempting to slow down my calculation speed and 'think', before offering an answer...
I have analyzed the emotional matrices of nigh-uncountable lifeforms; it has never troubled me. And yet, I cannot deny that Amiya invokes in me a wholly new emotion. Is it because she is special... or because I am special?
Could it truly be that the data of Theresa's memories impacts my logic routines? Sufficient time will inevitably yield an answer, and I am eternal.
But I have come to grasp at least one thing: Amiya is simple.
I have learned the look in her eyes when she looks at me.
>ND_DWDB_CLOSED

'Huh? How high are the access privileges for these logs? Can't I query them? What are they even about?'
'Some logged data, Amiya. Some stories. About me, and you.'
And they are mine and mine only.
modules.name: Another Story

modules.description:
Neural stimulants, whether taken orally, injected or inhaled, can temporarily increase one's perceptive and cognitive powers, but become a health risk with long-term usage.
Coffee serves a similar function to neural stimulants for landwalkers. The creation of coffee involves a complex process whereby the fruit of the coffee plant is processed multiple times using specific techniques, equipment, and procedures.
There are many detailed subcategories of coffee products by taste and quality, and the process of its usage is equally complex. Landwalkers consume coffee orally at specified times and occasions, with specific rules for how it is consumed.
Despite being more harmful than typical neural stimulants, coffee appears to be far less effective. No obvious stimulation effects were observed after consuming ten standard portions of Siracusan espresso. How could such complex manufacturing and usage procedures lead to such a mild effect?
...
Systematic research has revealed that the manufacturing and usage of coffee is a terrestrial ritual. The meaning behind the complex manufacturing process is manifested in the form of taste of quality, and perceived by the user when consumed orally. Emphasis on a specific time and place asserts the solemnity of the ritual, while rules about consumption increases the sense of participation. The user is subject to a form of psychic suggestion to stay awake, which compensates for any deficiencies in actual potency.
While the rituals involved are complex and difficult to comprehend, there may be lessons to be learned from the employment of psychic suggestion as a form of mental stimulation. Although the Institute of Development Planning will intervene in the event that an Ægir citizen overuses neural stimulations by rescheduling work or adjusting requirements, individual citizens, out of an obsession for their creative activities or personal values, may occasionally ignore the IDP's intervention and continue to administer neural stimulants in large quantities. While adjustive measures exist to deal with the circumstances of such citizens, there is a need for a less harmful form of neural stimulation to assist them during a creative fever. Progress has been made to reduce the side effects of neural stimulants through technological means, but perhaps we could also investigate the possibility of integrating terrestrial psychic suggestion into the use of neural stimulants, in order to achieve the same effect with a lower dosage...
We should leave some of the experiment results for him. He could use it... assuming we don't have to execute him when he comes back.
modules.name: A Neural Stimulant Based on 'Coffee'

modules.description:
Lazvar opens the heavy door that has shielded him from people's hostility for more than a decade. Absentmindedly, he grabs the beast teaser hanging behind the door and makes a few flicks towards the inside of the room.
One, two, three.
The newly-engraved gemstone on the tip of the teaser glows faintly, flickering against the darkness, yet the familiar figure doesn't appear as expected. Lazvar stops. It suddenly dawns on him that Mio is never going to magically emerge from nowhere and rush towards him again. Sighing deeply, he hangs the teaser back.
'Click.' With a faint mechanical sound, soft light illuminates the depths of the room. Priceless gems, coveted even in Menat-Ha'mait, flood the bookshelves and desks, casting vibrant, colorful reflections. In this most secure and secretive room of the Grand Bazaar, they have silently painted an ethereal illusion.
These are the fruits of many years of hard work by Lazvar's family. To protect them from bandits and thieves, Lazvar has memorized the precise position of every brick in these four walls, even noting how they're covered by dust.
But none of that matters now, for he is finally going to put his long-carried mission aside and leave this place that has begun to paralyze his mind.
Before going, Lazvar needs to pack the most important things first. Wait, what are those things on the list again?
Oh yes, the portrait of Mio, Woof and him from a couple of years ago... Here, right behind the shelf. They persuaded him into getting one as a commemoration of coming-of-age, but after the portrait was completed, Woof insisted on hiding it here, claiming, 'Who has ever seen any beckbeast and cloudbeast as large as us!' Mio was so offended that they refused to eat for two days.
That old scratching board of Mio is still under the desk! Actually, it was originally a gemstone pillow they gave him when he was little; after Lazvar fell asleep, Mio would curl up next to his head. Later, the pillow became Mio's scratching board, and so Lazvar wrapped it in a brand-new blanket for them to use.
Of course, there's also this teasing stick behind the door, which was originally a retractable rod gifted by Woof. It used to have a clockwork fowlbeast attached to it. Mio liked to carry this rod in her mouth, and they would chase each other around the house...
Other than those things, there's only this pile of gemstones sitting here, their beauty now meaningless to him.
Lazvar takes out a broken clockwork fowlbeast—a prop Mio once used countless times at his bedside to perform their trick of 'swallowing a toy and throwing it up whole again', just to make him laugh. The badly-scratched clockwork fowlbeast now lies quietly in his palm, though. It seems Mio has grown out of these kinds of tricks too.
Lazvar clears the carbon box of exquisite gemstones and refills it with his few cherished memories. After some tugging and bumping, everything falls back into silence.
'Stop watching. We should leave too.'
A voice softly rings from a dark corner of the room once Lazvar seems to have gone far enough away.
modules.name: Traces From the Past

modules.description:
From Marcille's reading notes...
I sat in on some 'Originium Arts' lectures. It's what they call magic here, and there are several different schools of it—my explosion magic falls under the School of Evocation. When it was Skyfire's turn to demonstrate, the class suggested we compare the differences between our magic. Afterwards, I caught the whiff of barbecue—they shared a skewer with me and made me swear not to tell Skyfire. I think she knew anyway, because the temperature around her shot up noticeably. Not to mention, it was cold that day, to the point Mint invited me to tag-team hug Skyfire. She was wonderfully warm at first, but quickly got a little too toasty!
Familiar summoning falls under the School of Transmutation, which is where Originium energy is used to alter something's physical composition. The class was dying to see my familiars against Mudrock's Colossi in a tug-of-war, which we refused. However, someone mentioned a game called 'beast arenas', which aren't contests of brute strength, but a magician's wisdom and skill—now this we couldn't refuse. After eventually bringing a box into the room, we made our miniature familiar and 'rockbeast' respectively. Still, Mudrock didn't even need to lift a finger to control hers! I worked my butt off trying to win!
......
While listening to them chat after class, I discovered that Yan's Chief of Lungmen is reputedly extremely handsome, and his wife is the princess of a neighboring country. Not only does she ride motorbikes, but she also has a personal ninja maid! With love blossoming amidst the intricacies of politics, they must have faced countless challenges to be together. The family head even dispatched a ninja to capture the princess. The sight of the chief and the princess together in love moved the stoic and loyal ninja, prompting her to aid them, even if it meant sacrificing herself. On a dark and stormy night, the chief carved a bloody path with his sword to reach the captive princess's chambers. They dashed to her motorbike and screeched away from their pursuers into the night. The ninja, gravely injured while covering for them, faintly smiled as she watched them ride away and then closed her eyes... There's no doubt about it—that's exactly how it happened! And obviously, the chief and the princess went back later to save the ninja!
I know the bookstall here has a tale of their love in stock. I'm going to get my hands on it!
......
I was only expecting a casual read. I had no idea of the truth... I'm noting down their profiles while I can!
Wei Yenwu: The elder brother of Yan's Lung. Carries a red longsword on him. No one expected he'd fall in love at first sight with a foreign lady.
Fumizuki: The Princess of Higashi. A free soul determined to rule her own life.
Shirayuki: Loyal ninja. Would do anything for her princess.
I'm bringing Falin this novel along with all the books on Arts theory! I just know she'll love it!
modules.name: Book Collection of the Best Magician

modules.description:
All along his search for Rhodes Island, Laios has been quietly gathering odds and ends in anticipation of his return to the dungeon, where he might continue studying their wonders.
 
INTIMIDATION POSES. A set of hand-drawn how-tos by Laios for use in combat, one for the mock-gloompincer (imitate mandibles with the arms as a deterrent) and one for the mock-Originium slug (arch the body and imitate pricking with the hands). The gloompincer chart also has a small annotation to the side: 'could be interpreted by male gloompincers as a mating ritual.'
SKETCH OF MON3TR. Multiple hand-drawn sketches of Mon3tr from different angles by Laios. Finely rendered, but the abdomen and claws are given a jarring level of detail, possibly suggesting he had the chance to observe up close while being grabbed by Mon3tr. Small annotation to the side: 'so cool!'
A FEATHER. Confirmed by Zumama to be from the High Priest, who has filed with Rhodes Island for a restraining order. Nevertheless, countless operators report seeing the High Priest waiting in areas Laios frequents, and even perching on his head. HR operators suspect the High Priest may actually be enjoying the attention.
SEEDS. Sami silencing chestnut seeds (P.S. works on Marcille), Rim Billitonian bottletree fruit (P.S. is swimming in the tree trunk possible?), Iberian seagrass roots (P.S. tongue numb after taste), etc. Doodle on a note to the side of a walking mushroom, with... the head of an Originium slug?
SEA TERROR IN A BOTTLE. A small Sea Terror kept in a bottle. Laios occasionally feeds it different things to test what it eats, and observes how it is able to change form in such a short time. Unfortunately, this one hasn't demonstrated even the slightest metamorphosis, which has more than saddened Laios.
 
Laios had a spot in his armor where he could nestle these items safe and sound, but in a tragic turn of events, Marcille spotted his Sea Terror during feeding time, and then everything else too, ending in the forcible disposal of the entire bundle by her hands.
Operators at the scene report that Laios was 'like a hoarding musbeast who had a year's worth of food soaked by rain,' and simply walked away down the corridor with his head hung low. He contacted HR and relayed the day's events out of concern for the repercussions, following which we discovered the Sea Terror in a standard wastebin in an ordinary Rhodes Island hallway.
Pursuant to this, HR has elected to commend Marcille for her safety awareness, and to act on an immediate and pressing need to put Laios through safety training.
modules.name: Trophies to Bring Back to the Dungeon

modules.description:
'Senshi, I've got the thing I wanted to show you!'
'Laddie... your knapsack looks fit to burst. Don't you have any others?'
'None big enough to hold any of this stuff. It's all so strange, haha.'
'That fascinating, is it? This cookware you wanted me to see.'
'Just wait until you see it! I picked out the perfect one, if I say so myself. Here, it's a cooking pot. All you do is put the ingredients in, press the button, and it automatically cooks it for you.'
'Come again? You press this button, nothing else, and the food makes itself?'
'Yep, exactly.'
'Don't even need a fire?'
'Nope. If I remember right, it uses Originium technology for the cooking.'
'Originium technology?'
'Like, you pick a cooking method, and that signals the Originium circuits inside the pot to start working, so the air valve closes, and the element heats up, so steam builds inside the pot and raises pressure... I'm not sure what it all implies, though. I just heard that was how it worked.'
'Originium circuits...'
'With higher atmospheric pressures, the boiling point of water increases. This elevation in boiling point facilitates quicker cooking times. As a result, recipes that previously required extended stewing periods can now be completed in relatively shorter durations. That's what the manual says.'
'Atmospheric... boiling points...'
'For seasoning, there are all sorts of different packets with concentrated seasoning. Curry, chili, bolognese, the works. All you have to do is put the right amount in along with your ingredients. Press the button, wait until the alert sounds, and it's done.'
'Concentrated seasoning...'
'It's either extracted from the foods, or directly synthesized based on their compositions. With these helpers, even people who've hardly used a kitchen before can make some pretty delicious dishes.'
'Synthesized... composition...'
'Senshi, what's the matter?'
'Laios, when did you start learning culinary magic?'
'Wh... what?'
'This sounds like nothing but magic to me! I've been telling you how those wizarding elves and gnomes end up too complacent and lazy from cooking with their magic! You know how dangerous that is in the dungeon!'
'You say that, but why are you taking the pot anyway?'
'I only wish to study it. Although I don't approve of cooking with magic, I can be sure of one thing: this type of cookware is essential to the Terran way of life. It's something I can learn more about Terra through.
'In colder places, folks tend to store food in containers with better insulation. In hot places, people prefer those that cool off faster, are more breathable, and easier to wash.
'You have to learn the lives of the locals to prepare the food that they enjoy.
'Just like in the dungeon, aye?'
modules.name: Non-Magical Culinary Arts

modules.description:
One day, in a Durin bar near the Acahuallan jungle, where every vintage boasts at least a quarter-century...
'Hear the news? Apparently the Liquor Association had an accident at the hangar yesterday.'
'Don't need to hear it, I was there! They made a worse ruckus than last time. Three cheers once more to the poor old Terran Society For The Protection of Durin People!'
'Last time some idiot gave an automaton a champagne bubble bath and hit a control chip, right? What happened this time?'
'Ale.'
'Really? It's the booze again?'
'Have you been to their hangar? They keep their entire stockpile of booze there, emphasis on the pile. Barrels and bottles all over. I'd be suspicious if nothing went wrong!'
'Too true. And they never learn! It was a nightmare to subdue the Spirit of Liquor last time! Well, what about this time?'
'The Association wanted to rein it in themselves, so they threw every engineer they had at it... and they're all proudly hospitalized now.'
'Brutal... So they had to call for help again?'
'Funny luck, actually. The moment they made the call, an expert came to them and solved it.'
'Expert? Go on?'
'Foreigner, complete stranger, 'bout a head shorter than you. Says he's some kinda specialist at disarming mechanical traps. At first, everyone thought he was an engineer from somewhere else, but no, he made it clear he's not. Claims he's an adventurer, just gathering supplies nearby before heading back to some dungeon. The Association thought he was drunk off his rocker, but hey, let him have a go if he wants, right? So they shake hands, and the moment they let go he's vanished into the hangar. Next thing you know, he's working his magic like a pro.'
'Hold on, Spirit of Liquor's a deathtrap, sure, but it's not like a trap-trap, is it?'
'Suppose it's all the same if you're good enough. By the time I got there, the hangar was back out of lockdown. He'd disassembled the machine so thoroughly, the place was a sea of parts.'
'Trust them to get a dab hand like him—Wait, that means the problem's been solved, right? So why haven't I seen anyone from the Association all day?'
'Problem solved meant the Association compensated him from their stash of ale like they agreed on. But you know how they are when they find someone who truly appreciates the brew. They threw a grand feast and made the foreigner their honored guest.'
'...And?'
'You wouldn't believe the liver on that foreigner. The little quarter-pint drank the entire Association under the table!'
modules.name: Authentic Locksmith's Instruments

modules.description:
'Laurentina, your outfit looks lovely today,' Blandus's voice comes through the glass of the partition. Laurentina turns with a smile and offers a quick 'thank you' as she gracefully leaves the lab. On the other side, Secunda suddenly stands up from behind the file shelf, staring intently at Ulpianus's back.
After a moment's hesitation, she speaks resolutely. 'Professor, I have a personal question.'
'Ask.' Ulpianus doesn't turn around.
'Why do you always wear the same clothes? You've been dressed like that since the day I met you.'
'Frankly, he's been dressing like that since he was a student. He's hardly changed his outfits at all over the years as I remember, and they always follow the same style, each more buttoned-up than the last. But I'd rather discourage such idle curiosity,' Blandus chimes in.
'Wrong question.' Ulpianus still doesn't turn around, his voice cold and firm.
'Understood!' Secunda answers brightly as she quickly leaves the lab.
Twenty minutes later, she reappears at the door.
'Professor, let me rephrase my question. Why do you rotate between dozens of outfits that look identical but differ slightly in material, craftsmanship, weight, and texture?'
'Still imprecise,' Ulpianus says, casting a quick glance at her before returning to his work sorting the mountain of Seaborn specimens.
Another twenty minutes pass, and Secunda appears again at the lab entrance, pen in hand.
'Professor, I've compared the differences in your outfits and analyzed the changes in your physical metrics, and I've found a preliminary correlation. Considering that combat gear aids Hunters in coordinating bodily movements, I hypothesize that you adjust details in your attire to match changes in your physical state, ensuring optimal control over your body in all conditions.'
After a brief silence, Ulpianus's ear moves slightly, as if signaling her to continue.
'However, this hypothesis leaves some gaps. Is there another variable influencing your choice of attire?'
'Indeed, Secunda.' Ulpianus finally turns around. 'You haven't noticed the correlation between the songs I compose pre-battle and my chosen outfit, but as those compositions have never been recorded, it's understandable you didn't realize this.'
'You mean, the other variable is...'
'My thoughts at the time.'
'Hold on!' At some point, Blandus had emerged from the partition. 'Ulpianus, that's not what you said when you explained it to me! You said it was because you didn't want to attract—'
'There are always more than one reason, Blandus.' Ulpianus cuts him off. 'What I told you was what you needed to know, and what I told her was what she needed to know. Nothing more.'
modules.name: Vestiarium Ulpiani

modules.description:
毫无疑问，这个奇怪的唱片机是双亲的杰作，妮芙看着眼前的小盒子，重重地叹了一口气。
自从姐姐把卡兹戴尔的近况和自己加入了罗德岛的消息递送给两位亲爱的家长后，他们就时不时地往家里寄送些稀奇古怪的东西，像是什么写不了字的笔、吹不出声的哨子、玻璃状的假花......还有这个......妮芙没仔细去看，顺手把随着盒子一起送来的唱片放上去，只见那张圆盘在盒子里一个劲地转，但就是固定不了，忙活了半天，都没听到一点声响。
妮芙拿起唱片正反看了一下，又用手测了测唱片的厚度，虽然确实比一般的唱片要厚一点，背面也没有孔......嗯？妮芙又看了眼，唱片背面确实没有穿孔，而是平整的锁背......难道——妮芙取出一把钥匙，半信半疑地戳了戳钥匙孔。
钥匙的前端完全没入了唱片，轻轻转动后，能听到锁件被打开的声音。这真是一个锁孔！但妮芙没有感受到任何情感，仿佛这个唱片并不是情感的载体，只是一个纯粹的装饰品。妮芙重新将它放在唱片机上，钥匙似乎起到了转轴的作用，将唱片固定于唱片机上。随着放上唱头，唱片缓缓转动了起来。
妮芙房间中依旧没有声响，但她感受得很清楚，从那把钥匙中释出的情感——那是最纯粹、最真切的爱意，明明诞生于笞心魔那充满痛苦的仪式，却轻柔温暖，就像是......
敲门声将妮芙从恍惚中唤醒，她打开房门，两个常在街道上游走的小萨卡兹出现在了她眼前。
“在烤红薯吗妮芙？”
“你是不是在温瘤奶？”
两个小萨卡兹问出了截然不同的问题，但妮芙意识到，答案其实是相同的。
那是他们心中对于暖意的定义，而勾起他们内心温暖的，就是她双亲送来的那件唱片机。
他们真的做到了吗？将这种独属于笞心魔的情绪感受，分享给每一个萨卡兹，甚至是——
“感觉像是奶奶正坐着摇椅给我织毛衣。”身为菲林的罗德岛外勤干员如是说道。
每一个泰拉人？
妮芙拔下钥匙，插入自己那块对应的心锁中。
虽然有些差异，但两者释出的情绪是一致的。
毫无疑问，这件礼物能与众人分享情感。
当然，前提是它的主人得是一位乐于与他人分享的笞心魔。
想到这里，妮芙打心底里感谢了一下自己古灵精怪的点子王父亲与巧手的工程师母亲，天底下最了解子女的，莫过于一对笞心魔父母了。
思考半天后，她带着唱片机和一把带有火焰装饰的钥匙前往了埃芒加德的住处。
她有了一个关于魂灵熔炉的、大胆的想法。
modules.name: 心声

modules.description:
'With all that, are you sure you have enough vouchers to pay for it?' An operator selecting daily necessities cannot help but worry as they look at Mitm's bulging shopping bag.
'I've got a few coupons about to expire, so I need to use them up,' Mitm says, pushing an overflowing shopping cart from behind the shelf.
'Whoa! Look at all that stuff! I'd better check out now—I don't want to be stuck behind you in line.'
By the time Mitm reaches the checkout counter, a crowd had already gathered there, waiting for the show.
The logistics operator at the register looked fully prepared. 'Bring it on!' they cry.
The scanner beeps nonstop, as the total amount on screen keeps zooming skyward.
'Your total is... 997.5 LMD!'
'Hold on a second...' Mitm says as he reaches into the inner pocket of his coat.
'Planning to pay with your personal operator points? The 5% discount has already been applied.'
The crowd offers scattered applause, though the logistics operator shows no sign of relief. He knows the battle has only just begun.
'Is that so...' Mitm pulls out a large stack of vouchers, all in different colors, from his coat. 'I'd like to use these coupons too, please.'
The onlookers begin to murmur with excitement.
'Limited-time anniversary commemorative discount vouchers, new operator breakfast vouchers... these ones have expired.' The logistics operator carefully sorts through the stack and pulls out the few invalid ones.
The scanner beeps again, but this time, the number on the screen begins to drop steadily.
Fifteen minutes later, it displays '103 LMD.' The logistics operator finally smiles. 'Still above 100 LMD. Ha.'
Mitm frowns, scans the area, then fixes his gaze on the clock across from him.
'Add this.' Mitm picks up a pack of gum and hands it to the logistics operator. 'Also, it's just past 8 PM—after 8, fruit and deli are half-price.'
The logistics operator's smile freezes. The number on the display flickers, settling at 84.75.
The crowd erupts into cheers.
'Wait!' The logistics operator isn't ready to give up yet. He eyes the shopping bag hanging from Mitm's tail. 'What about that big bag? I haven't scanned anything in it yet!'
Mitm's expression changes. 'These are personal items!'
'No, I saw what's in it! A big box of cystymilk and some detergent... that's at least 30 LMD—I haven't lost yet!'
The logistics operator lunges forward, while Mitm swings his tail, sending the shopping bag flying.
The box of cystymilk spins in the air, the hinge on its side flipping open to reveal hidden blades; the detergent bottle opens wide, revealing a remote-controlled car and an energy reserve unit inside.
For a moment, a torrent of blades and metal tools flies everywhere...
'I told you, they're my personal items!'
'Who would hide dangerous items in milk cartons and detergent bottles?! Can't you use a normal toolbox like everyone else?'
'It's called 'camouflage'! If I carried a toolbox, even a kid would know there's a weapon inside.'
modules.name: Beware of the Edges

skills.name: Blessing of the River of Life
Curse of the River of Death

modules.description:
Soon to return to Acahualla, Kemar takes her flashcards with her. The handwriting's kind of immature, and she doesn't need them to remember what the words mean now, but still she hooks them on her belt, the well-worn eyelet fraying day by day.
'These ones, I brought from home. The rest, I picked on the outside,' replied Kemar once upon a time, when a Rhodes operator was curious about the flowers on her cards. At first, they were how the girl of the rainforest learned her way through other languages—they fascinated her since she was young. Tender little plants. As enrapturing as a flying fist, and they called to her the way the wild things did.
On a certain level, these flowers held more strength than any brave warrior. Their names and stories were some of the earliest things Kemar knew by heart: learning how the people beyond the rainforest colored the four seasons with them, interpreted their lives with them. What describes these flowers now are no longer unfamiliar words, but a ring of keys, hung on her waist, opening each of Terra's doors alongside her.
'Look well, it's our tribe's tallest, mightiest warrior! Her footprints are left in places even our imaginations couldn't reach! And now, she's back!' Kemar parts the grass weave over the doorway, and is met headon with the eager chatter of her tribesfolk, in her native language. Eventually, she stirs; in this most familiar of rainforests, she'll never be needing any 'key'.
The tribe's kiddies mill around Kemar, jabbing zealously at all the names on her flashcards' flowers, pestering her to tell all her stories from beyond the forest.
'Beyond the rainforest... it's very wide.'
Kemar recalls the most exciting moment of her own language-learning Not the first time she understood a spoken word. Not being able to fluently converse with Big Boss Blaze. It was when she realized she could finally explain to others, coherently and clearly, the things that all the flowers of her home represented.
'...But don't let me tell you about it. You should all go see it for yourself!
